EmailTemplate.subject: Memory Management Fundamentals: How To Scale Today's Data Center
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<http://vmturbo.com/resources/memory-management-fundamentals-e-book?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=memorymanagementwp&utm_content=07142015> {{lead.First Name:default=edit me}},
A lot of the time, memory is the most constrained resource in a virtualized environment. There are a number of techniques that hypervisors employ to manage memory. Virtualization allows us to over commit memory, which improves utilization, but can lead to other problems if not managed properly.
In our latest e-book; Memory Management Fundamentals: Memory Ballooning, Memory Swapping, Hypervisor Swapping, and more <http://vmturbo.com/resources/memory-management-fundamentals-e-book?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=memorymanagementwp&utm_content=07142015> learn about:
- Memory Ballooning - Memory Swapping - Hypervisor Swapping - The Limits of Traditional Techniques at Scale - How Economic Abstractions Enable Scaling
- The VMTurbo Team <http://vmturbo.com/resources/memory-management-fundamentals-e-book?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=memorymanagementwp&utm_content=07142015>
